name: Padded Armor
description: Quilted layers of cloth designed to absorb glancing blows, though the bulk makes stealth difficult.

name: Leather Armor
description: Hardened leather plates that offer basic protection without sacrificing mobility.

name: Studded Leather Armor
description: Leather armor reinforced with metal studs, balancing protection and agility.

name: Hide Armor
description: Thick animal hides crudely fashioned into armor, favored by druids and tribal warriors.

name: Chain Shirt
description: A shirt of interlocking metal rings worn beneath clothing for discreet protection.

name: Scale Mail
description: Leather armor reinforced with overlapping metal scales that provide solid defense but rattle loudly.

name: Breastplate
description: A fitted metal chest piece worn over flexible armor, offering strong protection with minimal noise.

name: Half Plate Armor
description: Interlocking metal plates covering vital areas, combining flexibility with heavy protection.

name: Ring Mail
description: Leather armor reinforced with metal rings, providing basic heavy protection.

name: Chain Mail
description: Interlocking metal rings that offer excellent coverage at the cost of weight and noise.

name: Splint Armor
description: Vertical metal strips riveted to leather backing, designed for frontline combat.

name: Plate Armor
description: Interlocking steel plates that fully encase the wearer, the pinnacle of mundane armor.

name: Shield
description: A sturdy handheld barrier of wood or metal that provides additional protection.
